refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The server object is the object listening for connections on a port and creating GstRTSPClient objects to handle those connections.

The server will listen on the address set with gst_rtsp_server_set_address() and the port or service configured with gst_rtsp_server_set_service(). Use gst_rtsp_server_set_backlog() to configure the amount of pending requests that the server will keep. By default the server listens on the current network (0.0.0.0) and port 8554.
The server will require an SSL connection when a TLS certificate has been set in the auth object with gst_rtsp_auth_set_tls_certificate().

To start the server, use gst_rtsp_server_attach() to attach it to a GMainContext. For more control, gst_rtsp_server_create_source() and gst_rtsp_server_create_socket() can be used to get a GSource and GSocket respectively.
gst_rtsp_server_transfer_connection() can be used to transfer an existing socket to the RTSP server, for example from an HTTP server.

Once the server socket is attached to a mainloop, it will start accepting connections. When a new connection is received, a new GstRTSPClient object is created to handle the connection. The new client will be configured with the server GstRTSPAuth, GstRTSPMountPoints, GstRTSPSessionPool and GstRTSPThreadPool.
The server uses the configured GstRTSPThreadPool object to handle the remainder of the communication with this client.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GstRTSPServer instance.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_address ()
refsect2.para: Get the address on which the server will accept connections.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the server address. g_free() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_address ()
refsect2.para: Configure server to accept connections on the given address.
This function must be called before the server is bound.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_service ()
refsect2.para: Get the service on which the server will accept connections.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the service. use g_free() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_service ()
refsect2.para: Configure server to accept connections on the given service. service should be a string containing the service name (see services(5)) or a string containing a port number between 1 and 65535.
When service is set to "0", the server will listen on a random free port. The actual used port can be retrieved with gst_rtsp_server_get_bound_port().
This function must be called before the server is bound.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_backlog ()
refsect2.para: The maximum amount of queued requests for the server.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_backlog ()
refsect2.para: configure the maximum amount of requests that may be queued for the server.
This function must be called before the server is bound.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_bound_port ()
refsect2.para: Get the port number where the server was bound to.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_mount_points ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPMountPoints used as the mount points of server .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPMountPoints of server . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_mount_points ()
refsect2.para: configure mounts to be used as the mount points of server .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_session_pool ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPSessionPool used as the session pool of server .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPSessionPool used for sessions. g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_session_pool ()
refsect2.para: configure pool to be used as the session pool of server .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_thread_pool ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPThreadPool used as the thread pool of server .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPThreadPool of server . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_thread_pool ()
refsect2.para: configure pool to be used as the thread pool of server .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_get_auth ()
refsect2.para: Get the GstRTSPAuth used as the authentication manager of server .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstRTSPAuth of server . g_object_unref() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_set_auth ()
refsect2.para: configure auth to be used as the authentication manager of server .

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_transfer_connection ()
refsect2.para: Take an existing network socket and use it for an RTSP connection. This is used when transferring a socket from an HTTP server which should be used as an RTSP over HTTP tunnel. The initial_buffer contains any remaining data that the HTTP server read from the socket while parsing the HTTP header.

entry.para: the IP address of the remote client
the port used by the other end
any initial data that was already read from the socket.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if all was ok, FALSE if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_io_func ()
refsect2.para: A default GSocketSourceFunc that creates a new GstRTSPClient to accept and handle a new connection on socket or server .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the source could be connected, FALSE if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_create_socket ()
refsect2.para: Create a GSocket for server . The socket will listen on the configured service.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GSocket for server or NULL when an error occurred.

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_create_source ()
refsect2.para: Create a GSource for server . The new source will have a default GSocketSourceFunc of gst_rtsp_server_io_func().

cancellable if not NULL can be used to cancel the source, which will cause the source to trigger, reporting the current condition (which is likely 0 unless cancellation happened at the same time as a condition change). You can check for this in the callback using g_cancellable_is_cancelled().
This takes a reference on server until source is destroyed.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GSource for server or NULL when an error occurred. Free with g_source_unref().

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_attach ()
refsect2.para: Attaches server to context . When the mainloop for context is run, the server will be dispatched. When context is NULL, the default context will be used).
This function should be called when the server properties and urls are fully configured and the server is ready to start.

This takes a reference on server until the source is destroyed. Note that if context is not the default main context as returned by g_main_context_default() (or NULL), g_source_remove() cannot be used to destroy the source. In that case it is recommended to use gst_rtsp_server_create_source() and attach it to context manually.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the ID (greater than 0) for the source within the GMainContext.

refsect2.title: GstRTSPServerClientFilterFunc ()
refsect2.para: This function will be called by the gst_rtsp_server_client_filter(). An implementation should return a value of GstRTSPFilterResult.
When this function returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REMOVE, client will be removed from server .
A return value of GST_RTSP_FILTER_KEEP will leave client untouched in server .
A value of GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF will add client to the result GList of gst_rtsp_server_client_filter().

entry.para: user data that has been given to gst_rtsp_server_client_filter()

refsect2.title: gst_rtsp_server_client_filter ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList * gst_rtsp_server_client_filter (GstRTSPServer *server, GstRTSPServerClientFilterFunc func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Call func for each client managed by server . The result value of func
determines what happens to the client. func will be called with server
locked so no further actions on server can be performed from func .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REMOVE, the client will be removed from server .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_KEEP, the client will remain in server .
If func returns GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF, the client will remain in server but will also be added with an additional ref to the result GList of this function..
When func is NULL, GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF will be assumed for each client.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GList with all clients for which func returned GST_RTSP_FILTER_REF. After usage, each element in the GList should be unreffed before the list is freed.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPServer
refsect2.para: This object listens on a port, creates and manages the clients connected to it.

refsect2.title: struct GstRTSPServerClass
refsect2.para: The RTSP server class structure

entry.para: Create, configure a new GstRTSPClient object that handles the new connection on socket . The default implementation will create a GstRTSPClient and will configure the mount-points, auth, session-pool and thread-pool on the client.
emitted when a new client connected.

refsect2.title: The address property
refsect2.para: The address the server uses to listen on.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: "0.0.0.0"

refsect2.title: The backlog property
refsect2.para: The maximum length to which the queue of pending connections may grow.
Flags: Read / Write
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 5

refsect2.title: The bound-port property
refsect2.para: The port number the server is listening on.
Flags: Read
Allowed values: [-1,65535]
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The mount-points property
refsect2.para: The mount points to use for client session.
Flags: Read / Write

refsect2.title: The service property
refsect2.para: The service or port number the server uses to listen on.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: "8554"

refsect2.title: The session-pool property
refsect2.para: The session pool to use for client session.
Flags: Read / Write

refsect2.title: The client-connected signal
refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
